snippet.title: DigiClip: Activating Physical Documents
snippet.description:
* DigiClip: Activating Physical Documents (Citations: 12)
Christian Decker, Michael Beigl, Adam Eames, Uwe Kubach
Today many documents are held in parallel as electronic files and as paper based documents. Keeping the properties of both versions in sync is important to assure consistency between the physical and virtual instances of one docu- ment. This paper introduces the DigiClip system that pro- vides a solution to automatically enforce such consistency by converting passive paper documents to ...
Conference: International Conference on Distributed Computing Systems - ICDCS(Workshop) , pp. 388-393, 2004

snippet.title: Family Facial Patch Resemblance Extraction
snippet.description:
* Family Facial Patch Resemblance Extraction
Mohammad Ghahramani, Wei-Yun Yau, Eam Khwang Teoh
Family members have close facial resemblances to one another; especially for certain specific parts of the face but the resemblance part differ from family to family. However, we have no problem in identifying such facial resemblances to guess the family relationships. This paper attempts to develop such human capability in computers through measurements of the resemblance of each facial patch ...
Conference: Asian Conference on Computer Vision - ACCV , pp. 388-399, 2010

snippet.title: Paving the Way for Implementing Multiagent Systems: Refining Gaia with AUML
snippet.description:
* Paving the Way for Implementing Multiagent Systems: Refining Gaia with AUML (Citations: 1)
Juan C. Garc ´ ia-Ojeda, Alvaro E. Arenas, J. Perez-Alcazar
This paper describes the integration process between the Gaia Methodology and AUML; this integration allows the developer to get a better insight into the multiagent system (MAS) that is being built. Gaia generates an abstract model based on roles that describe the system agents, their services and interactions. AUML uses that model as input and breaks it down into a ...

snippet.title: Paving the Way for Implementing Multiagent Systems: Integrating Gaia with Agent-UML
snippet.description:
* Paving the Way for Implementing Multiagent Systems: Integrating Gaia with Agent-UML
Juan C. García-ojeda, Álvaro Enrique Arenas, José De Jesús Pérez Alcázar
This paper describes how to refine a Gaia design by applying agent- oriented extensions of UML. First, we show how the Gaia Interaction model can be improved by applying the first two layers of the Agent Interaction Protocol (AIP) of AUML. Second, Gaia Agent and Service models are refined by apply- ing the AIP's third layer combined with Extended ...
Conference: Agent-Oriented Software Engineering - AOSE , pp. 179-189, 2005
